sections.purpose: To manually count microbial colonies using a pen and illuminated background.
sections.scope: Applicable where digital counters are not available.
procedure: Place the Petri dish on the illuminated background or grid.
Using a marker or hand tally counter, mark each colony as it is counted.
Move systematically across the plate to avoid double counting.
Record the total number of colonies and sample details.
precautions: Ensure good lighting and contrast to distinguish colonies.
Avoid contaminating the plate while handling.
Discard counted plates as biohazard waste.
Use eye protection if working for prolonged periods under bright light.
Do not reuse plates for further incubation after counting.
